intro: Crepidomanes makinoi, commonly known as Makino's bladderwrack, is a species of brown algae belonging to the family Fucaceae. It is characterized by its elongated, strap-like blades that are typically 10–30 cm in length. The plant has a distinct central axis with lateral branches and possesses a unique structure of small, bladder-like air bladders that help it float. It thrives in intertidal zones, often found attached to rocks in shallow coastal waters. The fronds are usually dark green to brown in color and can vary in texture depending on environmental conditions.
